diagrams.description: Software Development evolved from machine code programming to sophisticated engineering discipline. Early programming used machine code and assembly language (1940s-1950s) requiring intimate hardware knowledge. FORTRAN (1957) introduced the first high-level programming language for scientific computing. Structured programming emerged in the 1960s promoting goto-less code and modularity. The Waterfall model formalized by Royce (1970) established sequential development phases. Object-oriented programming gained prominence with Smalltalk (1970s) and C++ (1980s). The personal computer revolution (1980s) expanded software development accessibility. The Agile Manifesto (2001) revolutionized development methodology emphasizing collaboration and adaptability. Open source movement accelerated with Linux and Apache projects. Web 2.0 (mid-2000s) drove interactive application development. Mobile app development exploded with iPhone (2007) and Android platforms. Cloud computing transformed deployment and scaling in the 2010s. Containerization with Docker (2013) standardized application packaging. Microservices architecture gained adoption for scalable systems. Today's software development integrates AI-assisted coding, low-code/no-code platforms, cloud-native development, and DevSecOps security integration.
diagrams.mermaid_code:
timeline
    title Software Development Evolution
    1940s-1950s : Machine Code Era
                : Assembly language programming
    1957 : FORTRAN Language
         : First high-level language
    1960s : Structured Programming
          : Modular goto-less code
    1970 : Waterfall Model
         : Royce's sequential phases
    1970s-1980s : Object-Oriented Programming
                : Smalltalk & C++ emergence
    1980s : PC Revolution
          : Development accessibility
    2001 : Agile Manifesto
         : Methodology revolution
    Mid-2000s : Web 2.0
              : Interactive applications
    2007 : Mobile App Era
         : iPhone & Android platforms
    2010s : Cloud Computing
          : Transformed deployment
    2013 : Docker Containerization
         : Application packaging
    2020s : AI-Assisted Coding
          : Low-code & DevSecOps
